ygData.subject: RE: Market in EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Maybe to help the market, they could make it so we could customize our armor.  Different colors or something.  The code should not be an issue.  They have
ygData.messageBody:
Maybe to help the market, they could make it so we could customize our
armor. Different colors or something. The code should not be an
issue. They have different people working on different parts of code.
The same person working on bugs or warriors does not work on trades.

--- Paul Heenan <pheenan@...> wrote:
> From: Paul Heenan <pheenan@...>
>
> Artifacts of that magnitude would probably not
> deteriorate anyway. But
> wearing banded mail in the pouring rain for 1 year
> has to affect it somehow.
> I think it is a good idea, but they should not
> bother with it now. Too much
> coding involved. Maybe in the expansion pack or
> future projects.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: David Rogers [SMTP:derogers334@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 3:22 PM
> > To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Market in EQ
> >
> > From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
> >
> > --- velom@... wrote:
> > > Has anyone thought of or actually talked to
> Verant
> > > about having armor wear out? ...
> > > I don't know if this seems like a good idea or
> not.
> > > I think it does. Let me know what you all think
> of
> > > this idea.
> >
> > I hope Verant *never* implements any sort of item
> > degredation system. It would definitely *not* be
> fun;
> > especially with the camp lengths you have to
> endure
> > for some highly choice items (PGT comes to mind,
> as
> > does Rubicite, or holyswords, etc...).
> >
> > ===
> > :D
> > Dave's World
> > -No matter where you go, there you are-
> > "People will believe a lie either because they
> want to
> > believe it's true, or because they fear it is."
> Wizard's
